repositories.brief_summary: New Bool module functions, manual improvements, runtime fixes, and major compiler refactoring merged
repositories.new_features_summary: Added eager Bool.logand, logor, logxor functions and fixed C interface manual documentation
repositories.new_features:
- New **eager boolean functions** `Bool.logand`, `Bool.logor`, and `Bool.logxor` providing bitwise operations on booleans for performance-critical code ([c796b3b](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/c796b3b05fa42df6d033d127d6be25ded7c74114))
- Fixed **C interface manual** documentation correcting `hash_variant` to `caml_hash_variant` function name ([fa8cd4d](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/fa8cd4d714e3106970bfa0148d9c4adf8e73e67f))
- Enhanced **manual rendering** switching PDF generation from pdflatex to lualatex with improved Unicode support ([418f333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/418f3331942ae51608dbaea4a038f7587953d8f7))
- Improved **toplevel constructor printing** using shorter paths for better readability ([bee36ba](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/bee36baed2f71f4ac01eea5b343c01e71ead59ea))
- Fixed **cross-compilation builds** resolving issues with static compiler builds ([f28bfbc](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/f28bfbcb232b017460cb0ba7f9ec8cf1cf773811))
repositories.activity_summary: Extensive compiler refactoring by Samuel Vivien with typing system improvements and runtime optimizations
repositories.activity:
- **Major typing system refactoring** by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) across multiple modules including improvements to type application handling ([e74da11](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/e74da11b0786329abd1ea0e9250af34a4356ef1b)), typemod reorganization ([6616961](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/6616961116a50781a5e3ab665a26cd2c5239fbce)), pprintast refactoring ([3480dbd](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/3480dbd1ffba5f38cac1190ca1d0bf1d8a5cefa3)), and typetexp improvements ([af96835](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/af968358ffeee9eaae2389a090e7472a2a035e4a))
- **Runtime domain system** improvements by [@COCTI](https://github.com/COCTI) fixing generalization issues ([2ca16da](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/2ca16da04e1363acf7e5fe92053c5b2f0ed1bac2)) and simplifying multicore detection ([d89dd7b](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d89dd7bf3c59c89bd0d2f9173f0fbe5ca7483279))
- **Build system enhancements** by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) addressing cross-compilation challenges and CI infrastructure updates ([f28bfbc](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/f28bfbcb232b017460cb0ba7f9ec8cf1cf773811), [523e6a6](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/523e6a6253b11d0d9d99682a8436fb1efb2cdedc))
- **Documentation and manual improvements** by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) expanding Unicode support and modernizing LaTeX rendering ([multiple commits](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/418f3331942ae51608dbaea4a038f7587953d8f7))
- **Debugging tools** enhancements by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) adding support for variable domain numbers in debugger scripts ([0de4054](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/0de4054f265ab70d710d1a49138563cffe8ac152))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on internal compiler modernization with extensive typing system refactoring and tooling improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Extensive internal refactoring** across the typing system indicating preparation for future language features like modular explicits ([#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275))
- **Enhanced build system robustness** with improved cross-compilation support and CI infrastructure modernization reflecting focus on platform compatibility
- **Documentation modernization** moving from legacy LaTeX to Unicode-capable tooling suggesting improved accessibility for international contributors
- **Runtime system optimization** with atomic operations and domain handling improvements indicating ongoing multicore performance enhancements
repositories.contributors_summary: Samuel Vivien led major typing refactoring, with contributions from David Allsopp, Nick Barnes, Florian Angeletti, and others
repositories.contributors:
- [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) implemented extensive **typing system refactoring** across multiple modules including typemod, pprintast, and typetexp improvements, demonstrating deep work on compiler internals in preparation for modular explicits
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) contributed **build system fixes** for cross-compilation issues and updated CI infrastructure from Ubuntu 22.04 to 24.04, ensuring platform compatibility
- [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) enhanced **debugging tools** by updating debugger scripts to handle variable numbers of domains, improving multicore debugging experience
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) led **manual improvements** including Unicode support implementation and LaTeX rendering modernization, making documentation more accessible
- [@COCTI](https://github.com/COCTI) fixed **runtime domain issues** addressing generalization problems and simplifying multicore detection logic
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) contributed **toplevel printing improvements** implementing shorter path display for constructors and runtime thread management cleanup
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) worked on **type application refactoring** with improvements to typing infrastructure and code organization

repositories.brief_summary: Performance improvements, checksum options for source command, and repository management fixes merged
repositories.new_features_summary: Added checksum control options to source command and improved repository validation
repositories.new_features:
- Added `--require-checksums` and `--no-checksums` options to **source command** for checksum control, harmonizing with install command behavior ([#5563](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5563))
- Enhanced **repository remove command** to properly validate that specified repositories exist before attempting removal ([#5014](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5014))
- **Performance optimization** for `OpamStd.String.split` function using custom implementation instead of regex-based approach ([#6210](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6210))
- Improved **GNU patch detection** on macOS by prioritizing `gpatch` command due to Homebrew changes ([#6255](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6255))
- Added **winget installation** instructions to documentation for Windows users ([#6338](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6338))
repositories.activity_summary: Two ongoing PRs exploring environment variable output formats and Nushell shell support
repositories.activity:
- **Environment variable output** improvements being developed by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) to add flag for outputting environment bindings ([#6316](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6316))
- **Nushell shell support** implementation by [Benjamin Voisin](https://github.com/benjamin-voisin) enabling `opam env` to work with Nushell via JSON output ([#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6330))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on shell compatibility and CI/automation tooling improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Shell portability** improvements with both Nushell support and enhanced environment variable handling targeting CI and automation use cases
- **Performance optimization** efforts focusing on core string processing functions used throughout the codebase
- **Cross-platform compatibility** enhancements addressing macOS toolchain changes and Windows package manager integration
repositories.contributors_summary: Kate led multiple merged improvements while R. Boujbel and Benjamin Voisin work on shell integration features
repositories.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) merged multiple improvements including repository validation fixes ([#5014](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5014)), string processing performance optimization ([#6210](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6210)), and GNU patch detection fixes ([#6255](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6255))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) implemented checksum control options for the source command ([#5563](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5563)) and continues developing environment variable output improvements ([#6316](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6316))
- [Benjamin Voisin](https://github.com/benjamin-voisin) developed Nushell shell support implementation with JSON-based environment loading ([#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6330))

repositories.brief_summary: Infrastructure improvements with automated Nix flake updates and dependency management fixes
repositories.new_features_summary: Added automated Nix flake lock file updates and fixed development dependencies
repositories.new_features:

repositories.brief_summary: Major improvements to locate behavior using OCaml 5.3 features, plus new Emacs locate shortcut request
repositories.new_features_summary: Enhanced locate behavior using OCaml 5.3's uid information to distinguish interface from implementation files
repositories.new_features:
- **Improved locate behavior** using OCaml 5.3's uid source information to distinguish between interface and implementation files, resolving confusion where Merlin would incorrectly jump to constructors instead of module definitions ([#1857](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1857))
- **Smart locate mode** introduced as new `Smart option in locate configuration, automatically attempting to find corresponding definitions in implementations when blocking on interface uids
- **Enhanced project-wide renaming** support with better interface/implementation distinction for occurrence analysis
- **Fixed typeclass regression** that was breaking some functionality ([d1cacae0](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/commit/d1cacae010100bacbbb745de8824c78cc05bfa9b))
repositories.activity_summary: Multiple PRs merged improving locate behavior and index performance, plus new feature requests for Emacs integration
repositories.activity:
- **OCaml 5.3 integration** completed with [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) merging source information improvements ([#1857](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1857)) and Printtyp changes ([#1876](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1876)) to enhance locate accuracy and resolve interface/implementation confusion
- **Project-wide renaming** reached production readiness through [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) implementing union-find structures for aggregating linked declarations during indexing ([#1877](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1877))
- **Performance optimization work** ongoing with [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) developing granular marshal replacement for ocaml-index to improve search performance on large projects ([#1875](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1875))
- **Configuration flexibility** proposed by [@jonahbeckford](https://github.com/jonahbeckford) with .merlin.skip-if-not-cwd mechanism for complex project setups ([#1870](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1870))
- **Bug reports** submitted including short-paths handling issues with open statements ([#1873](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1873)) and filename path handling questions ([#1871](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1871))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on OCaml 5.3 integration and performance improvements for large-scale development workflows
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.3 feature adoption** with Merlin leveraging new compiler capabilities for better development experience, particularly around locate functionality and uid tracking
- **Large-scale project support** improvements addressing performance bottlenecks in ocaml-index and configuration complexity for monorepo-style setups
- **Enhanced cross-file analysis** capabilities with project-wide renaming and better interface/implementation coordination for modern development workflows
repositories.issues_summary: New Emacs feature request for alternative locate shortcut targeting interface files
repositories.good_first_issues: - **Emacs locate enhancement** requested by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) to add shortcut for ac-merlin-locate with flipped merlin-locate-preference, defaulting to interface files instead of implementation files ([#1878](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1878))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active development by Ulysse with multiple merged PRs, plus contributions from Charlène_Gros, Kate, Liam, and Jonah
repositories.contributors:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) led development with multiple merged improvements including OCaml 5.3 source information integration ([#1857](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1857)), project-wide renaming implementation ([#1877](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1877)), and Printtyp fixes ([#1876](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1876))
- [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) developed granular marshal optimization for ocaml-index performance improvements, engaging in detailed technical discussions with [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) about implementation details ([#1875](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1875))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) opened feature request for enhanced Emacs locate functionality ([#1878](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1878))
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) reported bug fixes for short-paths handling with open statements ([#1873](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1873)) and contributed to issue tracking discussions
- [@jonahbeckford](https://github.com/jonahbeckford) proposed configuration improvements for complex project setups and engaged in technical discussions about Merlin's file path handling ([#1870](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1870), [#1871](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1871))
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) provided detailed code review feedback and optimization suggestions for performance improvements

repositories.brief_summary: Dune 3.17.1 released with bug fixes for dynlink, file corruption, and empty project errors
repositories.new_features_summary: Three bug fixes released in 3.17.1: fixed dynlink, file corruption in copy operations, and empty project errors
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed **`.cmxs` file generation** for libraries declaring `(no_dynlink)` to prevent unnecessary builds ([#11176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11176))
- Resolved **file corruption bug** affecting `copy_files#` stanza and `copy#` action operations ([#11194](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11194))
- Removed **useless error message** when running `dune subst` in empty projects ([#11204](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11204))
repositories.activity_summary: Dune 3.17.1 maintenance release preparation with package solver refactoring and Melange improvements
repositories.activity:

- **Package solver refactoring** effort including removal of deprecated dependency importance levels and dead solver code cleanup ([#11236](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11236), [#11233](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11233), [#11223](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11223), [#11228](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11228), [#11227](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11227))

- **CI infrastructure cleanup** with removal of coveralls integration ([#11224](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11224))
repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion about autoformatting generated files before diff operations for improved developer experience
repositories.notable_discussions: - Discussion on implementing **autoformat for generated files** before diffing/promotion operations, with [Nathan Rebours](https://github.com/NathanReb) proposing integration with ocamlformat for better `deriving_inline` experience and [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) expressing support for the feature ([#2992](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/2992))
repositories.contributors_summary: Four contributors focused on maintenance: release management, solver refactoring, and Melange improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) managed the 3.17.1 release process including changelog preparation and version updates
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) implemented three bug fixes for the release: dynlink file generation, file corruption prevention, and empty project error removal ([#11176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11176), [#11194](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11194))
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) contributed to bug fixes, provided feedback on autoformat discussions, and performed CI infrastructure cleanup ([#11204](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11204), [#11224](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11224))

- Melange backend contributors improved compilation efficiency and removed redundant version tracking from stanza definitions ([#11207](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11207), [#11211](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11211), [#11206](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11206))

repositories.brief_summary: Ongoing technical discussion about garbage collection proposal addressing performance concerns and implementation details
repositories.activity_summary: One ongoing GC proposal RFC with detailed technical review feedback on performance considerations
repositories.activity: - **Garbage collection proposal** by [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) remains under review with active discussion about implementation details and performance implications ([#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
repositories.discussions_summary: Technical review of GC proposal focusing on remembered set implementation and performance trade-offs
repositories.notable_discussions: - **GC implementation strategy** discussion between [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) and [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) covering atomic operations, remembered set representation, and performance concerns about scanning the whole minor heap ([#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
repositories.contributors_summary: Christophe Raffalli authored ongoing GC proposal with Stephen Dolan providing detailed technical review feedback
repositories.contributors:
- [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) authored the ongoing garbage collection proposal RFC with 100 line additions covering new GC approach ([#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
- [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) provided detailed technical review feedback on the GC proposal, questioning implementation details and performance implications of the proposed remembered set approach ([#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))

repositories.activity_summary: Extensive package maintenance addressing 40+ unavailable sources, compatibility fixes for OCaml 5.3, and maintenance intent declarations
repositories.activity:
- **Massive unavailable source cleanup** by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) marking 40+ packages as unavailable due to defunct gforge.inria.fr sources including dose, javalib, sawja, coccinelle, and proverif packages ([11bf735](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/11bf7359691105017f07769c875d8c7f633200fe), [a398557](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/a398557234e64b9fdbcaa69645267501da5a13f7), [e5c4dd9](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/e5c4dd94051da82f025fac64819d6bf262225f71))
- **Package revival effort** updating 15+ packages to use opam-source-archive tarballs including mlpost, mysql, osdp, why, and zenon ([a630bc8](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/a630bc85b6f128722876c67925a022bd3f0f2e4b), [3f015dc](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/3f015dcfc7563016878fa4d2c8dd04014c037121))
- **OCaml 5.3 compatibility updates** including melange version constraints ([56a2bda](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/56a2bdaf73af3830eb5669e2dde22221e2999bf3)), dream-httpaf fixes ([2d648c5](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/2d648c510f87e67a9ea983ebcbbdc34178cdcf3a)), and older PPX packages upper bounds
- **Maintenance intent declarations** added by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) for 20+ packages including DNS, crypto, and networking libraries ([3e7d153](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/3e7d1533b6f36292da6b744b04338e8b83bfe666)) and [@chetmurthy](https://github.com/chetmurthy) for camlp5 packages ([b2fbdaf](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/b2fbdaf53a022404efc1741350427ea962073038))
- **Package deprecation initiative** marking unmaintained packages with deprecated flags including not-ocamlfind, patch, and http-client packages ([397c614](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/397c614994fe17deca9142d50ada43355a6e760d))
- **New package submissions** including archetype 1.5.3 ([7ea1f26](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/7ea1f2636855b139f2c810311e5a2d61cf4ef7dc)), jose 0.10.0 with ARM32 restrictions ([de6b008](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/de6b0081ad3373db56af1e7e7852e93c82ba1ee5)), and oidc 0.2.0 ([ca3a859](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/ca3a8593673aaa2f6bab69b6abf76eade88df5b6))
repositories.trends_summary: Strong focus on ecosystem health through proactive maintenance and OCaml 5.3 migration preparation
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Proactive package maintenance** with maintainers declaring explicit maintenance intentions and deprecating unmaintained packages rather than letting them stagnate
- **OCaml 5.3 ecosystem readiness** with widespread compatibility testing and updates across core packages, PPX tools, and build systems
- **Platform support expansion** particularly for Windows development with targeted conf package improvements for MSYS2 and Cygwin environments
- **Source reliability focus** addressing long-standing issues with defunct upstream repositories and transitioning to more reliable archive sources
- **Build system modernization** with continued Dune ecosystem evolution and improved developer tooling

repositories.brief_summary: Dropped IE support enabling modern JavaScript features and improved WASM runtime with new JSDoc feature request
repositories.new_features_summary: Dropped Internet Explorer support, enabled modern JavaScript features, and improved event handling
repositories.new_features:
- **Internet Explorer support dropped** across the entire codebase, removing legacy workarounds and enabling modern JavaScript features like `\v` escape sequences ([865249ee2](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/865249ee245e6e2f770bee5a22bcc2f3f08e9e0a))
- **Event handling improvements** with `preventDefault` method added to event interface for consistent event handling across all browsers ([4587ff59](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4587ff5957765825f3aba0a00e88fbfafe6669bd))
- **Test infrastructure enhancements** with version-specific output generation and better OCaml version constraints ([be85e6f7](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/be85e6f73903f91a04ed4e137e6dd1baaa6d44d0))
- **WASM runtime optimizations** including effect handling and JavaScript library improvements ([4587ff59](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4587ff5957765825f3aba0a00e88fbfafe6669bd))
repositories.activity_summary: Large WASM PR opened for JavaScript string implementation with new JSDoc feature request for TypeScript integration
repositories.activity:
- **Major WASM development** with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) opening comprehensive PR for OCaml string implementation using JavaScript strings, including conditional compilation, performance improvements, and compatibility features ([#1772](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1772))
- **TypeScript integration request** by [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) for multi-line JSDoc comments support to enable runtime type checking with TypeScript compiler ([#1777](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1777))
- **Legacy code cleanup** completed with IE support removal affecting DOM event handling, XHR requests, and HTML element coercion across multiple modules
- **Testing improvements** delivered through better OCaml version constraints and output file organization for cross-version compatibility
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on modernization by dropping legacy browser support and advancing WASM capabilities
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Legacy browser support removal** trend continuing with IE compatibility code elimination, enabling use of modern JavaScript features and cleaner codebase
- **WASM performance optimization** focus with string handling improvements and runtime enhancements for better JavaScript interoperability
- **TypeScript ecosystem integration** requests emerging for better tooling support and type checking capabilities
repositories.contributors_summary: Two core contributors active with WASM development and feature requests for TypeScript integration
repositories.contributors:

- [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) contributed test infrastructure improvements ([be85e6f7](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/be85e6f73903f91a04ed4e137e6dd1baaa6d44d0)) and opened feature request for multi-line JSDoc comments support ([#1777](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1777))

repositories.discussions_summary: Two ongoing technical discussions about resource type safety and DNS resolution issues on Linux
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Resource type safety** discussion by [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) exploring ways to make Eio.Resource more robust and prevent invalid uses that lead to runtime issues, with experimental branches investigating wrapped resources and object-based approaches ([#774](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/774))
- **DNS resolution failure** investigation by [Krzysztof Leśniak](https://github.com/serpent7776) reporting that `Eio.Net.getaddrinfo_stream` fails after exactly 1019 successful calls on Linux systems, with [Simon Grondin](https://github.com/SGrondin) providing guidance on proper Switch lifecycle management ([#776](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/776))
repositories.contributors_summary: Three contributors engaged in technical discussions addressing type safety and platform-specific DNS issues
repositories.contributors:
- [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) provided detailed analysis of type safety issues in Eio.Resource and shared experimental work on alternative approaches including wrapped resources and object-based implementations ([#774](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/774))
- [Krzysztof Leśniak](https://github.com/serpent7776) reported a specific DNS resolution bug affecting Linux systems and provided reproducible test cases ([#776](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/776))
- [Simon Grondin](https://github.com/SGrondin) offered technical guidance on Switch lifecycle management as a potential solution for resource cleanup issues ([#776](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/776))

- **Documentation enhancements** including UTop tutorial expansion in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) and comprehensive changelog updates for major releases
- **Cross-platform support expansion** with Windows-specific improvements in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) addressing conf package issues

- **Documentation presentation issues** with [Labdhi](https://github.com/labdhiongithub7) reporting syntax highlighting inconsistencies in [ocaml/ocaml.org#2870](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2870) and [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) providing guidance on upstream fixes
- **Build system optimization** discussion by [@wikku](https://github.com/wikku) in [ocaml/ocaml.org#2871](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2871) about TailwindCSS downloading multiple platform binaries
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Proactive ecosystem maintenance** with explicit maintenance intent declarations and systematic deprecation of unmaintained packages rather than allowing stagnation
- **OCaml 5.3 migration coordination** involving widespread compatibility testing, documentation updates, and synchronized release processes across core ecosystem components
- **Content quality standardization** with improved filtering mechanisms for Planet blogs, package search relevance, and RSS feed reliability to enhance user experience
- **Cross-platform development support** particularly targeting Windows environments with focused improvements to configuration packages and build system compatibility
- **Documentation-driven development** emphasizing tutorial improvements, changelog maintenance, and comprehensive user guidance for new features and migration paths

group_summaries.brief_summary: Active week with Dune 3.17.1 release, OCaml 5.3 integration in Merlin, and modernization efforts across multiple tools
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Major releases: Dune 3.17.1 bug fixes, Merlin OCaml 5.3 locate improvements, and js_of_ocaml IE support removal
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Dune 3.17.1 released** with three critical bug fixes: resolved `.cmxs` file generation for libraries declaring `(no_dynlink)` ([ocaml/dune#11176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11176)), fixed file corruption bug affecting `copy_files#` stanza and `copy#` operations ([ocaml/dune#11194](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11194)), and removed useless error message when running `dune subst` in empty projects ([ocaml/dune#11204](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11204))
- **Enhanced locate behavior in Merlin** using OCaml 5.3's uid source information to distinguish between interface and implementation files, resolving confusion where Merlin would incorrectly jump to constructors instead of module definitions ([ocaml/merlin#1857](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1857))
- **Smart locate mode introduced** in Merlin as new `Smart` option in locate configuration, automatically attempting to find corresponding definitions in implementations when blocking on interface uids
- **OPAM source command enhancements** with new `--require-checksums` and `--no-checksums` options for checksum control, harmonizing with install command behavior ([ocaml/opam#5563](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5563))
- **Internet Explorer support dropped** in js_of_ocaml across the entire codebase, removing legacy workarounds and enabling modern JavaScript features like `\v` escape sequences ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml@865249ee2](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/865249ee245e6e2f770bee5a22bcc2f3f08e9e0a))
- **Automated Nix flake lock updates** implemented in ocaml-lsp via new GitHub Actions workflow that runs weekly and on manual trigger ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp@1628871bc](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/commit/1628871bc216c708803376b83d2f4de05cafe4c0))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Major release activity** with [Dune 3.17.1](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) delivering three critical bug fixes for dynlink, file corruption, and empty project errors
- **OCaml 5.3 integration** advancing significantly in [Merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) with enhanced locate behavior and smart mode features
- **Modernization efforts** across tools including IE support removal in [js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) and infrastructure automation in [ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp)
- **Performance optimization focus** spanning multiple repositories with string processing improvements in [OPAM](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) and index optimization work in [Merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin)
- **Developer experience improvements** including better shell compatibility in OPAM, UI polish in [odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc), and protocol compliance work in ocaml-lsp
group_summaries.activity_summary: Package solver refactoring in Dune, project-wide renaming development in Merlin, and ongoing WASM improvements in js_of_ocaml
group_summaries.activity:
- **Package solver refactoring** progressing in [Dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with removal of deprecated dependency importance levels and dead solver code cleanup ([ocaml/dune#11236](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11236), [ocaml/dune#11233](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11233), [ocaml/dune#11223](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11223))
- **Project-wide renaming** reaching production readiness in [Merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) through [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) implementing union-find structures for aggregating linked declarations during indexing ([ocaml/merlin#1877](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1877))
- **Performance optimization work** ongoing with [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) developing granular marshal replacement for ocaml-index in [Merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) to improve search performance on large projects ([ocaml/merlin#1875](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1875))
- **Major WASM development** with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) opening comprehensive PR in [js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) for OCaml string implementation using JavaScript strings, including conditional compilation and performance improvements ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1772](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1772))
- **Shell integration improvements** in [OPAM](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) developing environment variable output enhancements ([ocaml/opam#6316](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6316)) and [Benjamin Voisin](https://github.com/benjamin-voisin) implementing Nushell support ([ocaml/opam#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6330))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **OCaml 5.3 feature adoption** coordinated across tools with [Merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) leveraging new compiler uid tracking capabilities for improved locate functionality ([ocaml/merlin#1857](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1857)) while [Dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) continues maintenance support for the latest compiler
- **Infrastructure automation trends** emerging with both [ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) implementing automated Nix flake updates ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1424](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1424)) and [OPAM](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) focusing on CI and automation tooling improvements for package management workflows
- **Developer tooling integration** advancing with [ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) protocol compliance work ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1429](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1429)) supporting [Merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin)'s enhanced project-wide analysis capabilities and locate features
- **Performance optimization coordination** with [Merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) index improvements ([ocaml/merlin#1875](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1875)) and [OPAM](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) string processing optimization ([ocaml/opam#6210](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6210)) addressing scalability needs for large OCaml projects
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Autoformat integration discussion** in [Dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with [Nathan Rebours](https://github.com/NathanReb) proposing integration with ocamlformat for better `deriving_inline` experience before diff/promotion operations, receiving support from [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([ocaml/dune#2992](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/2992))
- **TypeScript integration request** in [js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) by [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) for multi-line JSDoc comments support to enable runtime type checking with TypeScript compiler ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1777](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1777))
- **Complex project configuration** discussion in [Merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) with [@jonahbeckford](https://github.com/jonahbeckford) proposing .merlin.skip-if-not-cwd mechanism for complex project setups and engaging in technical discussions about file path handling ([ocaml/merlin#1870](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1870), [ocaml/merlin#1871](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1871))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.3 feature adoption** accelerating with [Merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) leveraging new compiler capabilities for enhanced development experience, particularly around locate functionality and uid tracking for better interface/implementation coordination
- **Infrastructure automation** becoming standard practice with automated dependency management in [ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1424](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1424)) and [OPAM](https://github.com/ocaml/opam)'s focus on shell compatibility and CI tooling improvements for modern DevOps workflows
- **Legacy code modernization** trend continuing with [js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) removing Internet Explorer compatibility ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml@865249ee2](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/865249ee245e6e2f770bee5a22bcc2f3f08e9e0a)), enabling use of modern JavaScript features and cleaner codebases
- **Large-scale project support** improvements addressing performance bottlenecks in [Merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) index operations ([ocaml/merlin#1875](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1875)) and configuration complexity for monorepo-style setups
- **Cross-tool integration** advancing with [ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) protocol compliance work ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1429](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1429)) and [OPAM](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) shell compatibility features ([ocaml/opam#6330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6330)) supporting modern development environments

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major compiler refactoring with new Bool functions merged, alongside ongoing GC proposal discussions
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Added Bool.logand/logor/logxor functions, fixed C interface docs, enhanced manual rendering and debugging tools
group_summaries.new_features:
- New **eager boolean functions** `Bool.logand`, `Bool.logor`, and `Bool.logxor` providing bitwise operations on booleans for performance-critical code ([ocaml/ocaml commit c796b3b](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/c796b3b05fa42df6d033d127d6be25ded7c74114))
- Fixed **C interface manual** documentation correcting `hash_variant` to `caml_hash_variant` function name ([ocaml/ocaml commit fa8cd4d](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/fa8cd4d714e3106970bfa0148d9c4adf8e73e67f))
- Enhanced **manual rendering** switching PDF generation from pdflatex to lualatex with improved Unicode support ([ocaml/ocaml commit 418f333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/418f3331942ae51608dbaea4a038f7587953d8f7))
- Improved **toplevel constructor printing** using shorter paths for better readability ([ocaml/ocaml commit bee36ba](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/bee36baed2f71f4ac01eea5b343c01e71ead59ea))
- Enhanced **debugging tools** adding support for variable domain numbers in debugger scripts ([ocaml/ocaml commit 0de4054](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/0de4054f265ab70d710d1a49138563cffe8ac152))
- Fixed **cross-compilation builds** resolving issues with static compiler builds ([ocaml/ocaml commit f28bfbc](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/f28bfbcb232b017460cb0ba7f9ec8cf1cf773811))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- Major internal refactoring efforts in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) led by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) with extensive typing system improvements preparing for future language features
- Runtime system optimizations and domain handling improvements by [@COCTI](https://github.com/COCTI) enhancing multicore performance
- Build system robustness improvements by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) addressing cross-compilation challenges and CI infrastructure updates
- Documentation modernization efforts by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) moving to Unicode-capable LaTeX tooling
- Ongoing technical discussions in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) around garbage collection proposal with detailed performance analysis
group_summaries.activity_summary: Extensive compiler refactoring, runtime optimizations, build system improvements, and active GC proposal review
group_summaries.activity:
- **Major typing system refactoring** by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) across multiple modules including improvements to type application handling ([ocaml/ocaml commit e74da11](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/e74da11b0786329abd1ea0e9250af34a4356ef1b)), typemod reorganization ([ocaml/ocaml commit 6616961](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/6616961116a50781a5e3ab665a26cd2c5239fbce)), pprintast refactoring ([ocaml/ocaml commit 3480dbd](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/3480dbd1ffba5f38cac1190ca1d0bf1d8a5cefa3)), and typetexp improvements ([ocaml/ocaml commit af96835](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/af968358ffeee9eaae2389a090e7472a2a035e4a))
- **Runtime domain system** improvements by [@COCTI](https://github.com/COCTI) fixing generalization issues ([ocaml/ocaml commit 2ca16da](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/2ca16da04e1363acf7e5fe92053c5b2f0ed1bac2)) and simplifying multicore detection ([ocaml/ocaml commit d89dd7b](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d89dd7bf3c59c89bd0d2f9173f0fbe5ca7483279))
- **Build system enhancements** by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) addressing cross-compilation challenges and CI infrastructure updates ([ocaml/ocaml commit f28bfbc](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/f28bfbcb232b017460cb0ba7f9ec8cf1cf773811), [ocaml/ocaml commit 523e6a6](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/523e6a6253b11d0d9d99682a8436fb1efb2cdedc))
- **Garbage collection proposal** by [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) remains under active review with detailed technical discussion about implementation details and performance implications ([ocaml/RFCs#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Runtime system focus** across both repositories with domain improvements in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) aligning with GC performance discussions in [ocaml/RFCs#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50) regarding multicore memory management
- **Typing system preparation** in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) for modular explicits ([ocaml/ocaml#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275)) may lead to future RFC proposals for language feature additions
- **Performance considerations** spanning both repositories with bool operation optimizations in the main compiler and atomic operations analysis in the GC proposal discussions
group_summaries.notable_discussions: - **GC implementation strategy** discussion between [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) and [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) covering atomic operations, remembered set representation, and performance concerns about scanning the whole minor heap ([ocaml/RFCs#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Extensive internal refactoring** across the typing system in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) indicating preparation for future language features like modular explicits ([ocaml/ocaml#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275))
- **Enhanced build system robustness** with improved cross-compilation support and CI infrastructure modernization reflecting focus on platform compatibility
- **Documentation modernization** moving from legacy LaTeX to Unicode-capable tooling suggesting improved accessibility for international contributors
- **Runtime system optimization** with atomic operations and domain handling improvements indicating ongoing multicore performance enhancements
- **Performance-focused discussions** spanning both compiler optimizations and GC algorithm improvements, reflecting continued emphasis on OCaml's performance characteristics

group_summaries.brief_summary: Limited activity focused on EIO resource safety discussions and KCAS code quality improvements
group_summaries.group_overview:

- **Seven repositories** ([ocaml-multicore/domainslib](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/domainslib), [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring), [ocaml-multicore/meio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/meio), [ocaml-multicore/saturn](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn), [ocaml-multicore/eio-trace](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio-trace), [ocaml-multicore/picos](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos), [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-iomux](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-iomux)) had no activity during this period
group_summaries.activity_summary: One merged PR for code formatting and one draft PR for algorithm verification across the group
group_summaries.activity:
- **Code formatting upgrade** merged by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) in [ocaml-multicore/kcas](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/kcas) updating to ocamlformat 0.27.0 ([ocaml-multicore/kcas#208](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/kcas/issues/208))
- **Algorithm verification work** initiated by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) with new draft PR for simplified core algorithm verification in [ocaml-multicore/kcas](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/kcas) ([ocaml-multicore/kcas#209](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/kcas/issues/209))

group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Resource type safety investigation** by [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) exploring ways to make Eio.Resource more robust and prevent invalid uses that lead to runtime issues ([ocaml-multicore/eio#774](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/774))
- **DNS resolution bug report** by [Krzysztof Leśniak](https://github.com/serpent7776) in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) showing `Eio.Net.getaddrinfo_stream` fails after exactly 1019 calls on Linux systems, with [Simon Grondin](https://github.com/SGrondin) providing guidance on Switch lifecycle management ([ocaml-multicore/eio#776](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/776))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:

weekly_summary.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.3 feature adoption acceleration** demonstrated through comprehensive compiler support integration in toolchain, particularly Merlin's leverage of new uid tracking capabilities for enhanced locate functionality, indicating systematic embracement of latest language features across development tools
- **Ecosystem maintenance maturity** with proactive package deprecation and source archiving procedures by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) addressing 40+ stale packages, reflecting evolved maintenance practices and quality assurance standards
- **Infrastructure automation expansion** seen in automated Nix flake updates in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp@1628871](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/commit/1628871bc216c708803376b83d2f4de05cafe4c0)) and shell compatibility improvements in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam), indicating modernization of development workflows
- **Typing system preparation** for advanced features with extensive refactoring by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) across multiple compiler modules, suggesting groundwork for future language features like modular explicits ([ocaml/ocaml#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275))
- **Cross-platform reliability focus** with Windows-specific improvements in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) configuration packages and Linux DNS resolution issue investigation in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio), reflecting continued emphasis on platform compatibility
- **Documentation modernization** transitioning from legacy LaTeX to Unicode-capable tooling in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) manual generation, supporting international contributors and improved accessibility
- **Code quality standardization** through formatting upgrades and algorithm verification work in [ocaml-multicore/kcas](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/kcas), indicating systematic approach to maintainability across the ecosystem
